page.title: 11LOCAL AMPHIBIANS
page.content: {FROGS} We see mating frogs in the spring. Frogs eggs are laid in jelly.The spawn is in massive clumps in the moor beside the school and in slow running parts of the river and in Farr Loch. When they hatch,the tadpoles swim around together.After a few weeks they grow a strong pair of back legs and then a smaller pair of front legs. { {NEWTS} Newts lay their eggs in the bogs on the moor,near the forestry gate opposite the school and throughout our area.The baby newts eat the tadpoles. Toads spawn and frog spawn are differant,toad spawn is in a line but frog spawn is in clumps.
